jobs.title: Translator
jobs.description:
Do you have a passion for new cultures and languages? Would you like to earn money doing something you already know?

If you answered yes to either of these questions, we want you.

A unique new opportunity has opened up for the savvy listener and talented tongue to work with the organisation that brought you Sona Circle - the world’s first and most loved social networking app that connects refugees with their immediate surroundings and opportunities. Sona Translate is a response to the growing need for initiatives to support refugees. As part of the #SONA100, a challenge we set to create 100 opportunities in 100 cities for refugees, we are leading by example, by recruiting translators. Sona Translate aims to create double digit positions in line with the challenge, and encourage other businesses to follow suit.

Sona Translate is a global first for a Translations Services Agency; we exclusively hire refugees to complete translation services, thus allowing us to positively impact the lives of the individual, their families and the wider community.

As a translator, you would be responsible for the translating from your native tongue to the target language within a 48 hour turnaround time. The document length could vary from 500-5000 words so we are looking for a self-starter, who is fluent in at least 2 languages. The successful candidate would be required to translate a variety of content, including but not limited to:

Commercial

Educational

Legal

Literary

Scientific

and Technical documents.

Responsibilities

You will need to:

Read through original material and rewrite it in the target language, ensuring that the meaning of the source text is retained
Use translation memory software, such as Wordfast, memoQ, Across, SDL Trados and Transit NXT, to ensure consistency of translation within documents and help efficiency
Use specialist dictionaries, thesauruses and reference books to find the closest equivalents for terminology and words used.
Use appropriate software for presentation and delivery.
Research legal, technical and scientific phraseology to find the correct translation
Liaise with clients to discuss any unclear points
Proofread and edit final translated versions
Consult with experts in specialist areas
Retain and develop knowledge on specialist areas of translation
Follow various translation-quality standards to ensure legal and ethical obligations to the customer.
Skill

You need to show evidence of:

fluency in two or more languages
a good understanding and in-depth knowledge of language/country-specific cultures, known as localisation
subject matter knowledge specific to the content you'll be translating
excellent writing skills and command of grammar
attention to detail combined with the ability to work quickly to meet deadlines
the ability to use initiative in a commercial context
proficiency in the use of a range of computer packages - knowledge of translation-oriented applications and software is helpful, though not essential
self-motivation
Eagerness to acquire new knowledge.
Working with us is a rewarding experience; gaining valuable insights and knowledge of the various business sectors, generating a sizeable income, whilst also supporting the most vulnerable communities.

Hours

Based on individual contracts completed working as an independent consultant for Sona Translate.

Salary

Competitive

If this sounds like your next job opportunity, apply for this role by emailing us your CV detailing why you would be the best candidate. Good luck!

Job Type: Contract
